title: SimilarPoll: "Battleground States" Lean Democrat in Senate and Gubernatorial Elections | Similarweb
description: Our poll finds voters in “battleground states” favor Democrats over Republicans in 5 of 9 Senate races and 6 of 9 Gubernatorial elections.
content: HomeBlogInsightsSimilarPoll: "Battleground States" Lean Democrat in Senate and Gubernatorial Elections Insights SimilarPoll: “Battleground States” Lean Democrat in Senate and Gubernatorial Elections Start your free trial by Sneha Pandey , Insights Manager 2 Min. October 13, 2022 X Facebook Linkedin Copy link Free Website Traffic Checker Discover your competitors' strengths and leverage them to achieve your own success Analyze Traffic A Similarweb survey finds that voters in “battleground states” are more likely to favor Democrats over Republicans in 5 of 9 Senate races and 6 of 9 Gubernatorial elections. The SimilarPoll 2022 Midterm Election Survey provides real-time election polling featuring responses from over 23,000 unique panelists nationwide and reveals that economic concerns are swaying voters: both Democrats and Republicans ranked “Inflation and Cost of Living” and “Economy” as the most important issues in America today while ‘Abortion’ is not as prominent in these voters minds as might have been expected, given the intense politics around that issue. The poll Similarweb’s proprietary Market Research Panel – a daily sentiment tracker of mobile phone users in the United States – to engage directly with users on their mobile devices and qualify attitudes and behaviors. Used commercially to provide businesses with a comprehensive view of consumer activity in the mobile ecosystem, this curated, longitudinal data-gathering proved remarkably accurate in the 2020 US presidential election and has been updated for analysis of key U.S. Senate and gubernatorial races. We also gathered a state-by-state breakdown of the panelists’ most important issues. Because we are able to poll survey participants on an ongoing basis, using their most recent responses as their views change, SimilarPoll provides a unique perspective that traditional polling cannot easily capture. Here is a peek at one key chart, which shows the state results where one party is favored by more than the poll’s margin of error: For more details, including state-by-state breakdowns, download the full report. The Similarweb Insights & Communications team is available to pull additional or updated data on request for the news media (journalists are invited to write to press@similarweb.com). When citing our data, please reference Similarweb as the source and link back to the most relevant blog post or similarweb.com/blog/insights/. Disclaimer: All data, reports and other materials provided or made available by Similarweb are based on data obtained from third parties, including estimations and extrapolations based on such data. Similarweb shall not be responsible for the accuracy of the materials and shall have no liability for any decision by any third party based in whole or in part on the materials. Image by Gerd Altmann from Pixabay by Sneha Pandey Insights Manager Sneha, a Purdue graduate, delivers data-driven insights on Retail, eCommerce, Politics, CPG, and B2B Software, helping Fortune 50 companies succeed.
